Package com.pantgwyn.objectsort

Class TextSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pantgwyn.objectsort.Sort<java.lang.String>
      • com.pantgwyn.objectsort.TextSort
  • public class TextSort
extends Sort<java.lang.String>
    Class for performing a Text sort.

    This provides a number of sort methods that may be used to sort java Strings. The caller must provide the appropriate comparator for the Strings being sorted. The sort input may be from an input file or from a callback function, Likewise the output may be either to an output file or to a callback function.

    Author:
    Dave Breeze

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextSort

        public TextSort()
        Default constructor for class ObjectSort

        This will by default use 50% of the available memory and non verbose messages.

      • TextSort

        public TextSort​(double memoryFactor,
                boolean verbose)
        Constructor for class ObjectSort
        Parameters:
        memoryFactor - a double that defines the available memory usage. This is a value that must be less than 1. It represents the fraction of available memory ObjectSort will aim to use.

        For example a value of 0.1 will result in 10% of available memory being used and a value of 0.75 will result in 75% of available memory being used. This value impacts whether or not an external or internal sort is performed.

        verbose - a boolean that controls verbose messaging

      • TextSort

        public TextSort​(double memoryFactor)
        Constructor for class ObjectSort
        Parameters:
        memoryFactor - a double that defines the available memory usage. This is a value that must be less than 1. It represents the fraction of available memory ObjectSort will aim to use.

        For example a value of 0.1 will result in 10% of available memory being used and a value of 0.75 will result in 75% of available memory being used. This value impacts whether or not an external or internal sort is performed.
